summary: This FBI interview summary documents an attempted interview with inmate Steven Hoffenberg at Fort Dix Federal Correctional Institution on October 12, 2010. Hoffenberg refused to answer questions about Jeffrey Epstein or the murder of Arthur L. Shapiro without a court-appointed attorney present, but indicated willingness to cooperate once an attorney was provided. He referred agents to a 2003 Vanity Fair article and a website.

keyFacts: Steven Hoffenberg, an inmate at Fort Dix Federal Correctional Institution, was interviewed by FBI agents on October 12, 2010.
Hoffenberg refused to answer questions about Jeffrey Epstein or the murder of Arthur L. Shapiro without a court-appointed attorney present.
Hoffenberg indicated he would be willing to cooperate and answer questions once a court-appointed attorney was provided.
Hoffenberg referred the FBI agents to a March 2003 Vanity Fair article and the website TowerInvestors.com for information.
Hoffenberg had pending civil matters against the Bureau of Prisons at the time of the interview.
